posts.title: Hired Wife
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Kendal Browning is a secretary in love with her boss, Stephen Dexter, a man who every spring succumbs to his weakness for blondes. Much to Kendal’s chagrin, Stephen’s current affliction is model Phyllis Walden. When Stephen’s cement company is threatened with a takeover by one of his competitors, Stephen’s attorney, Roger Van Horn, suggests …

posts._title: Jean Negulesco – Phone Call from a Stranger (1952)
posts.title: Phone Call from a Stranger
posts.excerpt: On a flight from Chicago to Los Angeles via Iowa, lawyer David Trask gets to know three of his fellow passengers as one technical issue after another leads to delays and unscheduled stops along the way. posts.title: Zama
posts.excerpt: Based on the novel by Antonio Di Benedetto written in 1956, on Don Diego de Zama, a Spanish officer of the seventeenth century settled in Asunción, who awaits his transfer to Buenos Aires.

posts.title: Nobi
posts.excerpt: Quote: Fires on the Plain opens to a harsh and unexpectedly cruel act, as Tamura (Eiji Funakoshi) is struck in the face by his commanding officer for returning to his under-provisioned and demoralized regiment. posts._title: Éric Rohmer – Le genou de Claire AKA Claire’s Knee (1970)
posts.title: Le genou de Claire
posts.excerpt: Quote: “Why would I tie myself to one woman if I were interested in others?” says Jerôme, even as he plans on marrying a diplomat’s daughter by summer’s end. posts._title: Jorge Sanjinés – Yawar mallku AKA Blood Of The Condor (1969)
posts.title: Yawar mallku
posts.excerpt: The reaction of an indigenous community against a group of foreigners who under the guise of development assistance are forcibly sterilizing the peasant women.
